transfossus: <entryFree id="n48790" type="main" key="transfossus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transfossus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of transfodio.</entryFree>
transfretanus: <entryFree id="n48791" type="hapax" key="transfre^ta_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trans-frĕtānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fretum</etym>, <sense id="n48791.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is beyond the sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transmarine</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
transfretatio: <entryFree id="n48792" type="hapax" key="transfre^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transfrĕtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>transfreto</etym>, <sense id="n48792.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a passing over a strait</hi> or <hi rend="ital">narrow sea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:26:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 26, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
transfreto: <entryFree id="n48793" type="main" key="transfre^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trans-frĕto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n48793.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [fretum], <hi rend="ital">to cross a strait</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pass over the sea</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n48793.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n48793.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam primum transfretaturi (Brundisium),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 34</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:26:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 26, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 6, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 8, 22</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n48793.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">transfretabantur in dies noctesque navibus ratibusque,</quote> <trans><tr>were ferried over</tr>, <tr>put across</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 4, 5</bibl></cit>.— * </sense><sense id="n48793.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae conversationem sine gubernaculo rationis transfretantes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>passing through</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Poen. 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
transfuga: <entryFree id="n48794" type="main" key="transfu^ga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transfŭga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen> <etym>transfugio</etym>, <sense id="n48794.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who runs over to the enemy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a deserter</hi> (cf. perfuga). </sense><sense id="n48794.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">transfuga non is solum accipiendus est, qui aut ad hostes aut in bello transfugit, sed et qui per indutiarum tempus ad eos, cum quibus nulla amicitia est, fide susceptā transfugit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:15:19:section=8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 15, 19, § 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non omnia illum transfugam ausum esse senatui dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:44:100" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 44, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scipio transfugas ac fugitivos bestiis objecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Epit. 51 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: proditores et transfugas arboribus suspendunt. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">barbari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:47" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:6:16" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 6, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:11:10" default="NO">3, 11, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48794.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">transfuga divitum Partes linquere gestio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:16:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 16, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paucissimi Quiritium medieinam attigere, et ipsi statim ad Graecos transfugae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 8, § 17</bibl></cit>: secuti sunt quasi transfugam, quem ducem sequebantur. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:14:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 14, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mundi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>from the Roman empire</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:335" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 335</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne fias istā transfuga sorte vide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:131:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 131, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. 1, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">metalli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:15:12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 15, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
transfugio: <entryFree id="n48795" type="main" key="transfu^gi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trans-fŭgĭo</orth>, <itype>fūgi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n48795.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to flee over to the other side</hi>, <hi rend="ital">go over to the enemy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">desert</hi> <cb n="TRAN" /> (very rare; syn. transeo). </sense><sense id="n48795.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">multi proximā nocte funibus per murum demissi ad Romanos transfugerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:25:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 25, 12</bibl></cit>: cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 6, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ages. 6, 2</bibl>; Auct. B. Hisp. 7, 4; 11, 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 16</bibl>.—In a comical transf.: <hi rend="ital">Ep.</hi> Ubi arma sunt Stratippocli? <hi rend="ital">Th.</hi> Pol illa ad hostes transfugerunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 28</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n48795.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ab afflictā amicitiā transfugere atque ad florentem aliam devolare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 30, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illius oculi atque aures atque opinio Transfugere ad nos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:6:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 6, 107</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
transfugium: <entryFree id="n48796" type="main" key="transfu^gi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transfŭgĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>transfugio</etym>. <sense id="n48796.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a going over to the enemy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">desertion</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ut transfugia impeditiora essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:43:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 43, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crebra, ut in civili bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 46</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n48796.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrarii,</quote> <trans><tr>a migrating to Rome</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> adv. Symm. 2, 503</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Christum de circumcisione,</quote> <trans><tr>conversion</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
transfulgeo: <entryFree id="n48797" type="hapax" key="transfulge^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trans-fulgĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n48797.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to shine</hi> or <hi rend="ital">glitter through</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aureae guttae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 7, 28, § 100</bibl></cit> (al. fulget).</sense></entryFree>
transfumo: <entryFree id="n48798" type="main" key="transfu_mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trans-fūmo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n48798.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to smoke through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to breathe out like smoke</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">equi per obseratas tabulas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 23, 331</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anhelitus compressae irae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:399" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 399</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
transfunctorius: <entryFree id="n48799" type="main" key="transfuncto_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trans-functōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fungor</etym>, <sense id="n48799.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">carelessly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">superficially performed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">careless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">negligent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perfunctory</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">praecepta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">expugnatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Val. 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
transfundo: <entryFree id="n48800" type="main" key="transfundo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trans-fundo</orth>, <itype>fūdi, fūsum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n48800.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to pour out</hi> from one vessel into another, <hi rend="ital">to pour off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transfuse.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48800.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquam in alia vasa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:12:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">harenam liquatam in alias fornaces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 26, 66, § 194</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:103" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 6, 34, § 103</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem mortuum in urnam,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to deposit the ashes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:769" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 769</bibl></cit>. —Mid.: sanguis in eas venas transfunditur, <hi rend="ital">pours</hi> or <hi rend="ital">discharges itself</hi>, Cels. praef. <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n48800.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes suas laudes ad aliquem,</quote> <trans><tr>to transfer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 14, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnem amorem in hanc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:31:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 31, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eorum mores in Macedonas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:8:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 8, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divinum spiritum in effigies mutas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">errantes animas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 79</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
transfusio: <entryFree id="n48801" type="main" key="transfu_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transfūsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>transfundo</etym>, <sense id="n48801.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pouring out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decanting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transfusion.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48801.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 18, 52, § 172</bibl></cit>: sanguinis, <hi rend="ital">a discharge</hi>, Cels. praef. <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n48801.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n48801.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A transmigration</hi> of a people: <cit><quote lang="la">quam valde eam (gentem) putamus tot transfusionibus coacuisse?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,029:22:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Scaur. 22, 43</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48801.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A transformation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">novatio est prioris debiti in aliam obligationem transfusio atque translatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:2:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 46, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
transfusus: <entryFree id="n48802" type="main" key="transfu_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transfūsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of transfundo.</entryFree>
transglutio: <entryFree id="n48803" type="main" key="transglu_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trans-glūtĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n48803.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to swallow down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gulp down</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinem suum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 3, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sucum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 19 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">catapotia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
transgredior: <entryFree id="n48804" type="main" key="transgre^dior"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trans-grĕdior</orth>, <itype>gressus, 3</itype>, <sense id="n48804.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>gradior</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to step across</hi>, <hi rend="ital">step over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">climb over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">go</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pass over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cross</hi> (class.; syn.: transeo, transcendo). </sense><sense id="n48804.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n48804.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n48804.3" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pomoerium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:17:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 17, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Taurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 8, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11, 20, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:21:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 21, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:54:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 54, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 24, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:33:2" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 33, 2</bibl>; 10, 27, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:63" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 89</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 56</bibl>; Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 20, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Padum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 22, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Rhenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:120:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 120, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnem Araxem ponte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 39 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paludem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:10" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munitionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 46</bibl></cit>: exanimatus concidit; <cit><quote lang="la">hunc ex proximis unus jacentem transgressus, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colonias,</quote> <trans><tr>to pass through</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 2</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: transgressos (sc. flumen) omnes recipit mons, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:26:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 26, 3</bibl> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:H. 1:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 66</bibl> Dietsch).—</sense><sense id="n48804.4" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Galli Transalpini in Italiam transgressi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:45:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 45, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Corsicam,</quote> <trans><tr>to cross over</tr>, <tr>sail over</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Macedoniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens Rheno transgressa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 27</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc Britanniae statum mediā jam aestate transgressus Agricola invenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol transgressus in Virginem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 18, 47, § 167</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:199" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 83, 85, § 199</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompeius transgressus ad solis occasum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 26, 27, § 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transgressus ad deos Augustus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:75:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 75, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48804.5" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to go over</hi> to another party (Tacitean): <cit><quote lang="la">transgredior ad vos, seu me ducem sen militem mavultis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4</bibl></cit>. 66: <cit><quote lang="la">in partes Vespasiani,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in partes alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48804.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (postAug.).<pb n="1891" /> <cb n="TRAN" />  </sense><sense id="n48804.7" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar dictator signis collatis quinquagies dimicavit, solus M. Marcellum transgressus, qui undequadragies dimicaverat,</quote> <trans><tr>going beyond</tr>, <tr>surpassing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 25, 25, § 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensuram,</quote> <trans><tr>to go beyond</tr>, <tr>exceed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 49, 50, § 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenis necdum duodevicesimum transgressus annum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:7:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 7, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:6:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 6, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus viri mentionem,</quote> <trans><tr>to pass over</tr>, <tr>omit</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:108:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 108, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">constantis amicitiae exemplum sine ullā ejus mentione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 7</bibl></cit>, ext. 2: <cit><quote lang="la">utinam hercule possem quae deinde dicenda sunt, transgredi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. 74, p. 321, 16</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Esp., in eccl. Lat.: mandatum Dei,</quote> <trans><tr>to transgress</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 15, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48804.8" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pass over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proceed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">paulatim ab indecoris ad infesta transgrediebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">possumus et ad illos brevi deverticulo transgredi, quos, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:1:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 1, 5</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 2 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>?*! <orth extent="full" lang="la">transgressus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, in a <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> sense: <cit><quote lang="la">transgresso Apennino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 27, 1</bibl></cit> (Madv. Apenninum).</sense></entryFree>
transgressibilis: <entryFree id="n48805" type="main" key="transgressi^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transgressĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>transgredior</etym>, <sense id="n48805.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that can be transgressed</hi>, Primas in Apoc. 3, 10.</sense></entryFree>
transgressio: <entryFree id="n48806" type="main" key="transgressi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transgressĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n48806.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a going across</hi>, <hi rend="ital">going over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">passing over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">passage</hi> (rare but class.). </sense><sense id="n48806.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gallorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:33:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 33, 81</bibl></cit>: tua in Germaniam, Mamert. Pan. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Maxim.</author> 7, 2</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">over the sea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:26:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 26, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48806.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n48806.3" n="A" level="2"> In rhet., i. q. the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">u(pe/rbaton,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">transposition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">transgressio est, quae verborum perturbat ordinem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 32, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transgressio concinna verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:54:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 54, 207</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:34" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:28" default="NO">9, 4, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:66" default="NO">8, 6, 66</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n48806.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A transition</hi> in speaking, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:78" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 78</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n48806.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A transgression</hi> of the law, Aug. Quaest. in Exod. n. 108; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 7, § 164</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
transgressivus: <entryFree id="n48807" type="main" key="transgressi_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transgressīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>; in the later gramm., <sense id="n48807.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that goes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">passes over into another class</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transgressive</hi> (late Lat.): verba (e. g. audeo, ausus sum; <cit><quote lang="la">gaudeo, gavisus sum, etc.),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 336</bibl></cit> P.</sense></entryFree>
transgressor: <entryFree id="n48808" type="main" key="transgressor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transgressor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n48808.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an infringer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transgressor</hi> of the law (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 215</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 39</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Alcim.</author> 2, 120</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
transgressus: <entryFree id="n48809" type="main" key="transgressus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transgressus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of transgredior.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n48810" type="main" key="transgressus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transgressus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>transgredior</etym>, <sense id="n48810.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a passing over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">passage</hi> (very rare); mostly <hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">auspicium prosperi transgressus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 43</bibl></cit> (37): vitare proelium in transgressu, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:26:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 26, 2</bibl> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:H. 1:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 65</bibl> Dietsch): <cit><quote lang="la">in transgressu amnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Euphratis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
transigo: <entryFree id="n48811" type="main" key="transi^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trans-ĭgo</orth>, <itype>ēgi, actum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>ago</etym>. <sense id="n48811.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n48811.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To drive through</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to thrust</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stick</hi> a weapon <hi rend="ital">through</hi> (syn. traicio): <cit><quote lang="la">per pectora transigit ensem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:376" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 376</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum per ambos pedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 857" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oedip. 857</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n48811.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to stab</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pierce</hi> one <hi rend="ital">through</hi> with a weapon, <hi rend="ital">to transfix</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transpierce</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladio pectus transigit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:10:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 10, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ipsum gladio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenem (cuspis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:473" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 473</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viscera (ensis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:545" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 545</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora (jaculum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:824" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 824</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semet ictu gladii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 5:16" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 5, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ictu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:ib. 39:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 39, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48811.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To carry through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bring to an end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to finish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">settle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">complete</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conclude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perform</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accomplish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">despatch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transact</hi> any business (the class. signif. of the word; syn.: absolvo, perficio). </sense><sense id="n48811.4" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">negotium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 14, 2</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 9, 21</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">illud, quod faciendum primum fuit, factum atque transactum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 6, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:14:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 14, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rebus transactis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:25:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 25, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transactā re, convertam me domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 4, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod plerumque non futura sed transacta perpendimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:2:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transactis jam meis partibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intus transigetur, si quid est, quod restet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid per aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:51:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 51, 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pleraque per se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 18, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 29:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 29, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prius de praetoribus transacta res, quae transigi sorte poterat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:25:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 25, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellorum egregios fines, quotiens ignoscendo transigatur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>by amnesty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transigitur rixa caede,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 151</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">fabulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. prol. 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comoediam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:prol. 11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. prol. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si transactum est,</quote> <trans><tr>if all is over</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 4, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: transactum de partibus ratus, Flor 4, 7, 13.—</sense><sense id="n48811.5" n="B" level="2"> In partic., in <cb n="TRAN" /> business lang., <hi rend="ital">to settle</hi> a difference or controversy, <hi rend="ital">to come to a settlement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agreement</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">understanding</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">decerno, statuo): postremo inter se transigant ipsi, ut lubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:5:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 5, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum reo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:32:section=79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 32, § 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:39:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 39, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliquo HS ducentis millibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:54:section=140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 54, § 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum privatis non poterat transigi minore pecuniā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:16:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 16, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem cum Oppianico transigit, pecuniam ab eo accipit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:13:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 13, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut secum aliquid, quālubet condicione transigeret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 31, 97</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum debitore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:15:17" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 15, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48811.6" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen.: transigere cum aliquā re, <hi rend="ital">to make an end of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put an end to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be done with</hi> a thing (mostly post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">optimum visum est committere rem fortunae et transigere cum Publilio certamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:12:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 12, 11</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">transigite cum expeditionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenebris imis abscondita jam cum luce transegerat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 204</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum spe votoque uxoris semel transigitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:44" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 44</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48811.7" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To dispose of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sell</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi facultas est transigendi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 3, 26, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod teneriores matres generant transigendum est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 13, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48811.8" n="C" level="2"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">to bring to an end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to lead</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spend</hi> (perh. only post-Aug.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. ago): tempus per ostentationem aut officiorum ambitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescentiam per haec fere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maximam aetatis partem per haec ac talia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transacto tribuniciae potestatis tempore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vixdum mense transacto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">placidas sine suspirio noctes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90:41" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 90, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:59" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non multum venatibus, plus per otium transigunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sponsalia filiae natalemque geniti nepotis silentio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pios et insontes amoeno in loco dicimus perpetuitatem transacturos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Nat. 2, 19 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem sermonibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 7, 4</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">transactus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">completed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">settled</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exceptio transacti negotii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:15:17" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 15, 17</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">transactum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. negotium), <hi rend="ital">a completed business</hi>, <hi rend="ital">settlement</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:15:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 15, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
transilio: <entryFree id="n48812" type="main" key="transi^li^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transĭlĭo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">trans-sĭlĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi or ŭi</itype> (the former in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 1, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 5, § 9</bibl>; the latter in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:727" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 727</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 7, 2</bibl>; Auct. B. Hisp. 19, 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:3:12 al" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 3, 12 al.</bibl>; <sense id="n48812.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">transilii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 39:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 39, 5</bibl></cit>), <itype>4</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [salio], <hi rend="ital">to leap</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jump</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">spring across</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to leap over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spring over</hi>, etc. (class.). </sense><sense id="n48812.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n48812.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illac per hortum transilivit ad nos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 1, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de muro ad nos, Auct. B. Hisp. 19, 3: transilire ex humilioribus in altiorem navem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:25:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 25, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hostium naves, Auct. B. Alex. 46, 4: per Thraciam, Macedoniam et Graeciam,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to hasten through</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:5:25" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 5, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc in Aegyptum subito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 6</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n48812.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama est, ludibrio fratris Remum novos transiluisse muros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">positas flammas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:727" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 727</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">retia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 8, 9, § 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:3:12" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vada,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 3, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaternos senosque equos,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to leap from one to the other</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:3:10" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 3, 10</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n48812.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to go quickly over to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hasten to join</hi> a party: <cit><quote lang="la">eadem aetas Neronis principatu ad Thessalum transilivit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 5, § 9</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n48812.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n48812.6" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hasten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make haste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pass rapidly</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ad ornamenta ea (i. e. aureos anulos) etiam servitute liberati transiliunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 2, 8, § 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">onyx in gemmam transilit ex lapide Caramaniae,</quote> <trans><tr>the name Onyx passed over</tr>, <tr>was transferred</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 6, 24, § 90</bibl></cit> dub. (v. Jan. ad loc.).— </sense><sense id="n48812.7" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">transilire ante pedes posita et alia longe repetita sumere,</quote> <trans><tr>to skip over</tr>, <tr>neglect</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:40:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 40, 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne rem unam pulcherrimam transiliat oratio,</quote> <trans><tr>to pass by</tr>, <tr>omil</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:33:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 33, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est in principatu tuo quod cujusquam praedicatio vel transilire vel praetervehi debeat?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:56:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 56, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non transilivi principis nostri consulatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 56:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 56, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proxima pars vitae transilienda meae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:2:146" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 2, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quis modici transiliat munera Liberi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>enjoy to excess</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:18:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 18, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
transilis: <entryFree id="n48813" type="hapax" key="transi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>transilio</etym>, <sense id="n48813.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that leaps</hi> or <hi rend="ital">goes across</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">palmes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 23, 35, § 211</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
transilitio: <entryFree id="n48814" type="main" key="transi^li_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transĭlītĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n48814.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a leaping over</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Psa. 38:2" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> in Psa. 38, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
transilitor: <entryFree id="n48815" type="main" key="transi^li_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transĭlītor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n48815.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who leaps over</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> in Psa. 38, p. 131</bibl>. <cb n="TRAN" /></sense></entryFree>
transitans: <entryFree id="n48816" type="hapax" key="transi^tans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transĭtans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [transito, <sense id="n48816.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">freq.</hi> of transeo], <hi rend="ital">going</hi> or <hi rend="ital">passing through</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">is (L. Tullius legatus) Juliā lege transitans,</quote> <trans><tr>passing through the province</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 21, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
transitio: <entryFree id="n48817" type="main" key="transi^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>transeo</etym>, <sense id="n48817.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a going across</hi> or <hi rend="ital">over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a passing over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">passage.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48817.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n48817.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">(solis) in aliud signum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 4 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic dicebas, eam esse ejus (speciei dei) visionem, ut similitudine et transitione cernatur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>by the passing by of atoms</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:37:105" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 37, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imaginibus similitudine et transitione perceptis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 19, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">visionum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 39, 109</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48817.3" n="2" level="3"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">a passage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entrance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">transitiones perviae jani nominantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:27:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 27, 67</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48817.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a going over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">desertion</hi> to a party: <cit><quote lang="la">sociorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:15:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 15, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 15, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 25, 1</bibl>; 28, 16, 8; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 5</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:16:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 16, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:20:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 20, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48817.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> * </sense><sense id="n48817.6" n="A" level="2"> The passing of a disease from one person to another, <hi rend="ital">infection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contagion</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 616</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48817.7" n="B" level="2"> In rhet., <hi rend="ital">a transition</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 26, 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 9, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48817.8" n="C" level="2"> In gram., <hi rend="ital">an inflection</hi> by declension or conjugation, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=103" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 103</bibl> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 982</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
transitivus: <entryFree id="n48818" type="main" key="transi^ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transĭtīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>transitio</etym>, <sense id="n48818.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">passing over</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbum,</quote> <trans><tr>transitive</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 982</bibl></cit> P.</sense></entryFree>
transitor: <entryFree id="n48819" type="main" key="transi^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transĭtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>transeo</etym>, <sense id="n48819.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who goes over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a passer by</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 2, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
transitorie: <entryFree id="n48820" type="main" key="transi^to_ri^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transĭtōrĭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. transitorius <sense id="n48820.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
transitorius: <entryFree id="n48821" type="main" key="transi^to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transĭtōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>transitus</etym>, <sense id="n48821.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adapted for passing through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">having a passage-way</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n48821.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 7, 23</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48821.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">passing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transitory</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">momentum, Boëth. Cons. Phil. 5, 6: vita,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Amic. p. 602</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dilectio atque delectatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Doctr. Chr. 1:35:39" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Doctr. Chr. 1, 35, 39</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">transĭtōrĭē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in passing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by the way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cursorily</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Helv. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loqui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 51, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">considerare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. 102" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. 102</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
transitus: <entryFree id="n48822" type="main" key="transi^tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of transeo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n48823" type="main" key="transi^tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transĭtus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>transeo</etym>, <sense id="n48823.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a going over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">passing over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">passage</hi> (class.; syn. trajectus). </sense><sense id="n48823.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n48823.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">fossae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:20:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 20, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumine impeditus transitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:20" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:8:13" default="NO">8, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 55</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 20, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 70</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 59</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:8:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 8, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:15:4:12" default="NO">15, 4, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in urbem nostram Junonis,</quote> <trans><tr>removal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:8:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 8, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48823.3" n="2" level="3"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">a passage-way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">passage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spiritus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the windpipe</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 24, 51, § 111</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">auditus,</quote> <trans><tr>the auditory passage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 2, 28, § 59</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n48823.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n48823.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A passing over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">desertion</hi> to another party: <cit><quote lang="la">facilis ad proximos et validiores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transitūs mora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Vitellium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in alienam familiam,</quote> <trans><tr>a passing over</tr>, <tr>adoption into</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:19:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 19, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48823.6" n="2" level="3"> Law t. t., <hi rend="ital">a transfer of possession</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 2, 13, 20</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n48823.7" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A passing over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">passing away</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempestatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 21, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48823.8" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A passing by</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">capta in transitu urbs Ninos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48823.9" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n48823.10" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a passing over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">passing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">change</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in illo a pueritiā ad adulescentiam transitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opportunos magnis conatibus transitus rerum,</quote> <trans><tr>revolutions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 21</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n48823.11" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n48823.12" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A means of passing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a transition</hi> from one step to another: <cit><quote lang="la">medius quidem gradus, nihil ipse significans sed praebens transitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:38" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in figuras alias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 36, 43, § 120</bibl></cit>. — Of the <hi rend="ital">transition</hi> of colors in shading, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 5, 11, § 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:21" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 2, 8, § 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 66</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">transition</hi> in sound, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:68" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 68</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48823.13" n="2" level="3"> In speaking. </sense><sense id="n48823.14" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A transition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc erit ad alia transitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:6:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad diversa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 3, 65</bibl></cit>: <foreign lang="greek">metabolh/,</foreign> id est transitus in aliud genus rhythmi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Armeniam transitum facimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:2:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 42, 2, 7</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde venusti transitus fiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:61" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 61</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48823.15" n="b" level="4"> In transitu, <hi rend="ital">in passing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by the way</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae leviter in transitu attigeram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 3, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in transitu aliquid tractare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in transitu non omittemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:10:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 10, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
transjacio: <entryFree id="n48824" type="main" key="transja^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trans-jăcĭo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. traicio <sense id="n48824.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
transjectio: <entryFree id="n48825" type="main" key="transjecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transjectĭo, transjectus, trans-jĭcĭo</orth>, v. traj-.</entryFree>
transjugatus: <entryFree id="n48826" type="hapax" key="transju^ga_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trans-jŭgātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [jugo], <sense id="n48826.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">passed through</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Athos mons) a Xerxe perfossus transjugatusque est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:2:10" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 2, 10</bibl></cit>. <pb n="1892" /> <cb n="TRAN" /></sense></entryFree>
transjungo: <entryFree id="n48827" type="hapax" key="transjungo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trans-jungo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n48827.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to harness differently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to tackle in elsewhere</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:38:section=8 sq" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 1, 38, § 8 sq.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
translapsus: <entryFree id="n48828" type="hapax" key="translapsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trans-lapsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [labor], <sense id="n48828.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gliding past</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hastening by</hi>: (diva) uno Padum translapsa volatu, Claud. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 1, 376</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
translaticie: <entryFree id="n48829" type="main" key="transla_ti_ci^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">translātīcĭē</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. translaticius <sense id="n48829.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
translaticius: <entryFree id="n48830" type="main" key="transla_ti_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">translātīcĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">trālātīcĭus</orth>) or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>translatum, v. transfero</etym>; in jurid. and publicists' lang., <sense id="n48830.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">handed down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transmitted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preserved by transmission</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hereditary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">customary.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48830.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">edictum,</quote> <trans><tr>an edict which a magistrate receives as made by his predecessors</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:44:section=114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 44, § 114</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 45, § 117</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:21:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 21, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:18:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 18, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 10</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n48830.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">usual</hi>, <hi rend="ital">common</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">di sunt locuti more translaticio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:7:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 7, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:33" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postulationes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">translatitia et quasi publica officia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:37:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 37, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deformitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propinatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humanitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:9:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 9, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc tralaticium est,</quote> <trans><tr>is common</tr>, <tr>old</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animalia (quaedam alicubi) non nasci, translaticium: invecta emori, mirum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 29, 41, § 76</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:39" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 5, 4, § 39</bibl>: nostri enim haec tralaticia, <hi rend="ital">the ordinary course of affairs</hi>, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 5, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48830.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Tropical</hi>, <hi rend="ital">metaphorical</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, 7</bibl>, §§ 55 and 64 Müll.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">translātīcĭē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">slightly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carelessly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">negligently</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:37:14:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 37, 14, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:16:1" default="NO">48, 16, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:1:55" default="NO">36, 1, 55</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
translatio: <entryFree id="n48831" type="main" key="transla_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">translātĭo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">trālātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>transfero</etym>, <sense id="n48831.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a carrying</hi> or <hi rend="ital">removing from one place to another</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a transporting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transferring.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48831.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n48831.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniarum translatio a justis dominis ad alienos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:14:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 14, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domicilii,</quote> <trans><tr>removal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 9</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n48831.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., of plants, <hi rend="ital">a transplanting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ingrafting</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 11, 14, § 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:10:20" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 10, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:41:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 41, 3</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n48831.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A pouring out</hi> into another vessel, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:52:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 52, 11</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n48831.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n48831.6" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">criminis,</quote> <trans><tr>a transferring</tr>, <tr>shifling off</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:42:section=91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 42, § 91</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:8:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 8, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 19, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:38" default="NO">3, 6, 38</bibl> sq. — </sense><sense id="n48831.7" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n48831.8" n="1" level="3"> Of speech or writing, <hi rend="ital">a version</hi>, <hi rend="ital">translation</hi> into another language, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 99, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Retract. 1:7:2" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Retract. 1, 7, 2</bibl>; Greg. Mag. in Job, 12, 6.—</sense><sense id="n48831.9" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A transfer</hi> to a figurative signification, <hi rend="ital">a trope</hi>, <hi rend="ital">metaphor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">translationes audaciores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:38:156 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 38, 156 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">durior ... verecunda,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 41, 165</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:25:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 25, 85</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 34, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:4 sq" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 4 sq.</bibl> al.—</sense><sense id="n48831.10" n="2" level="3"> In gram., <hi rend="ital">a transposition.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48831.11" n="a" level="4"> Of letters, <hi rend="ital">metathesis</hi>, Don. p. 1773 P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 437</bibl> ib.— </sense><sense id="n48831.12" n="b" level="4"> Of words: <cit><quote lang="la">id verborum translatione emendatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:9:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 9, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
translatitie: <entryFree id="n48832" type="main" key="transla_ti_ti^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">translātītĭē</orth>, v. translaticie.</entryFree>
translatitius: <entryFree id="n48833" type="main" key="transla_ti_ti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">translātītĭus</orth>, v. translaticius.</entryFree>
translativus: <entryFree id="n48834" type="main" key="transla_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">translātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>translatio, II. B.</etym>, <sense id="n48834.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to transference</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that is to be transferred</hi>, <hi rend="ital">translative.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48834.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">constitutio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:8:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 8, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus causae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:75" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 6, 52</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n48834.2" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">metalepsis</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">meta/lhyin,</foreign> quam nos varie translativam, transumptivam, transpositivam vocamus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:46" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 46</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">translātīvē</orth>, gram. t. t., <hi rend="ital">in transferred meaning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">metaphorically</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 17, 6, 23</bibl>; Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:22" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
translator: <entryFree id="n48835" type="main" key="transla_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">translātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>transfero</etym>. * <sense id="n48835.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">one who carries</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hands over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a transferrer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Verres, translator quaesturae, aversor pecuniae publicae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>who</tr>, <tr>as quæstor</tr>, <tr>transferred the public funds to Sylla</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:58:section=152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 58, § 152</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48835.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a translator</hi> (late Lat. for interpres), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 57, 5</bibl>; id. in Daniel, 4, 5; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 118</bibl>, Serm. 12, 7.</sense></entryFree>
translatus: <entryFree id="n48836" type="main" key="transla_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">translātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of transfero.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n48837" type="main" key="transla_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">translātus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">trālātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>transfero</etym>, <sense id="n48837.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a carrying along</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a bearing in procession</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">diligentius quam in tralatu vestita mancipia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 1:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 1, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:4:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 4, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
translego: <entryFree id="n48838" type="main" key="transle_go" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">translēgo</orth>, <itype>āvi</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n48838.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bequeath</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Joan. Tract. 5" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> in Joan. Tract. 5</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n48838.1" n="2" level="3"> * <orth extent="full" lang="la">trans-lĕgo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to read through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">read out</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 4, 1, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
translimitanus: <entryFree id="n48839" type="main" key="transli_mi^ta_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">translīmĭtānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>translimen</etym>, <sense id="n48839.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">from beyond the frontier</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">minitari imperio Romano turmas translimitanas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 24</bibl></cit>, n. 8. <cb n="TRAN" /></sense></entryFree>
transluceo: <entryFree id="n48840" type="main" key="translu_ce^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trans-lūcĕo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">trālūcĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> * <sense id="n48840.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To shine across</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">speculo in speculum translucet imago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:332" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 332</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n48840.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To shine through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">show through; to let shine through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be transparent</hi> or <hi rend="ital">translucent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille ... In liquidis translucet aquis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:354" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 354</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">selenitis ex candido translucet melleo fulgore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 67, § 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per raritatem (pontium) translucentibus fluviis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 43, 68, § 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">translucens fissura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 14, 24, § 104</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:29:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 29, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
translucidus: <entryFree id="n48841" type="main" key="translu_ci^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trans-lūcĭdus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">trālūcĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n48841.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transparent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">translucid.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48841.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">crystallus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 9, 46, § 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">membrana vitri modo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 37, 55, § 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">color,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 4, 15, § 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">candor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 10, 57, § 158</bibl></cit>. — * </sense><sense id="n48841.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">elocutio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8</bibl></cit>, praef. § 20.</sense></entryFree>
transmarinus: <entryFree id="n48842" type="main" key="transma^ri_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trans-mărīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n48842.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">beyond sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">coming from beyond sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transmarine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hospes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 2, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:24:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 24, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vectigalia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:29:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 29, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auxilia, Auct. B. Alex. 3, 5: res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:18:section=45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 18, § 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B.
