G. 6, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">transmarina atque adventicia doctri na,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>jurisprudence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:33:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 33, 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peregrinatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 3, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provinciae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 17:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 17, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
transmeabilis: <entryFree id="n48843" type="hapax" key="transme^a_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transmĕābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>transmeo</etym>, <sense id="n48843.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be passed through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">passable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spatium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Grat. Act. 35 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
transmeatorius: <entryFree id="n48844" type="hapax" key="transme^a_to_rius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transmĕātōrius</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n48844.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to passing through</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Valent. 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
transmeo: <entryFree id="n48845" type="main" key="transme^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trans-mĕo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">trāmĕo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n48845.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to go over</hi> or <hi rend="ital">across</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to go through</hi> (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic. or Cæs.): ad quem (lacum) ciconiae non transmeant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 29, 41, § 77</bibl></cit> (Jahn, permeant): <cit><quote lang="la">terrā marique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 62 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sole duodecim signa transmeante,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 11, 29, § 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid non transmeat (in cribrando) repetitur in pila,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 5, 26, § 87</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 180, 19</bibl> and 36: <cit><quote lang="la">transmeato freto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 28, 8, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:16:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 16, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">trama, quod trameat frigus id genus vestimenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=113" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 113</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
transmigratio: <entryFree id="n48846" type="main" key="transmi_^gra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transmī^grātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>transmigro</etym>, <sense id="n48846.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a removing</hi> from one country to another, <hi rend="ital">a transmigration</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 448</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:1:11 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 1, 11 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1</bibl> Esd. 6, 16; 10, 16.</sense></entryFree>
transmigro: <entryFree id="n48847" type="main" key="transmi_^gro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trans-mī^gro</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n48847.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to remove</hi> from one place to another, <hi rend="ital">to migrate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transmigrate</hi> (not ante - Aug., and very rare). </sense><sense id="n48847.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem quaesituri sumus, quo transmigremus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:54:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 54, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Veios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:53:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 53, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e Carinis Esquilias in hortos Maecenatianos transmigravit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 15</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n48847.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of plants, <hi rend="ital">to be removed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transplanted</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 32, 59, § 136</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n48847.3" n="II" level="1"> (In late Lat.) <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be removed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">colonized</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 3, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui transmigrati habitaverunt in Samariā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 9, 2, 54</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
transmissio: <entryFree id="n48848" type="main" key="transmissi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transmissĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>transmitto</etym>, <sense id="n48848.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sending across</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a passing over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">passage</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 17, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab eā urbe in Graeciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 3, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48848.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The return</hi> or <hi rend="ital">payment in</hi> of duties, taxes, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 2, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
transmissus: <entryFree id="n48849" type="main" key="transmissus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transmissus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of transmitto.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n48850" type="main" key="transmissus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transmissus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>transmitto</etym>. * <sense id="n48850.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A giving</hi> or <hi rend="ital">handing over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a transferring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transmission</hi>: nunc regnum potitur transmissu patris, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 481, 32</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 69 Rib.).—</sense><sense id="n48850.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A passing over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">passage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">transmissus ex Galliā in Britanniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex portu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maris transitus transmissumque navibus factum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:26:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 26, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
transmitto: <entryFree id="n48851" type="main" key="transmitto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trans-mitto</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">trāmitto</orth>, <itype>mīsi, missum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n48851.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To send</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carry</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">convey across</hi>, <hi rend="ital">over</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">through; to send off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">despatch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transmit</hi> from one place or person to another (syn.: transfero, traicio, traduco). </sense><sense id="n48851.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi illam ut tramittas: argentum accipias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illam sibi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus equitatusque celeriter transmittitur (i. e. trans flumen),</quote> <trans><tr>are conveyed across</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:51:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 51, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohortem Usipiorum in Britanniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classem in Euboeam ad urbem Oreum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnam classem in Siciliam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:41:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 41, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde auxilia in Italiam transmissurus erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:32:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 32, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:15:7" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 15, 7</bibl>: transmissum per viam tigillum, <hi rend="ital">thrown over</hi> or <hi rend="ital">across</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:26:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 26, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ponte transmisso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: in <cb n="TRAN" /> partem campi pecora et armenta, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">materiam in formas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:8:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 8, 6</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n48851.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To cause to pass through</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">per corium, per viscera Perque os elephanto bracchium transmitteres,</quote> <trans><tr>you would have thrust through</tr>, <tr>penetrated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 1, 30</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ensem per latus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 1165" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 1165</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facem telo per pectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 1089" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Thyest. 1089</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per medium amnem transmittit equum,</quote> <trans><tr>rides</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:24:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 24, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Gallorum reguli) exercitum per fines suos transmiserunt,</quote> <trans><tr>suffered to pass through</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:24:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 24, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abies folio pinnato densa, ut imbres non transmittat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 10, 19, § 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Favonios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut vehem faeni large onustam transmitteret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 15, 24, § 108</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48851.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n48851.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To carry over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transfer</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum in Italiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 20, 4</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitia cum opibus suis Romam (Asia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:4:12" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 36, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: vim in aliquem, <hi rend="ital">to send against</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">employ against</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 38</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48851.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To hand over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transmit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et quisquam dubitabit, quin huic hoc tantum bellum transmittendum sit, qui, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>should be intrusted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:14:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 14, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui signa et summam belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:383" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 383</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hereditas transmittenda alicui,</quote> <trans><tr>to be made over</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:18:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 18, 7</bibl></cit>; and with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et longo transmisit habere nepoti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:3:78" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 3, 78</bibl></cit> (analog. to dat habere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:362" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 362</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and, donat habere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 262</bibl></cit>); <cit><quote lang="la">for which: me famulo famulamque Heleno transmisit habendam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 329</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne meum tempus amicorum temporibus transmittendum putavi,</quote> <trans><tr>should be devoted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poma intacta ore servis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 54</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48851.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To let go</hi>: animo transmittente quicquid acceperat, <hi rend="ital">letting pass through</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">forgetting</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 99:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 99, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mox Caesarem vergente jam senectā munia imperii facilius tramissurum,</quote> <trans><tr>would let go</tr>, <tr>resign</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Junium mensem transmissum,</quote> <trans><tr>passed over</tr>, <tr>omitted</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 12</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gangen amnem et quae ultra essent,</quote> <trans><tr>to leave unconquered</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:4:17" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leo imbelles vitulos Transmittit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:596" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 596</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48851.7" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To go</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pass over</hi> or <hi rend="ital">across</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cross over; to cross</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">go through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">traverse</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n48851.8" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n48851.9" n="1" level="3"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n48851.10" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">grues cum maria transmittant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:49:125" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 49, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur ipse tot maria transmisit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:29:87" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 29, 87</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">maria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:3:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis constante famā jam Iberum Poenos transmisisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:20:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 20, 9</bibl></cit> (al. transisse): <cit><quote lang="la">quem (Euphratem) ponte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluvium nando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:239" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 239</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacum nando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:347" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 347</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">murales fossas saltu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:554" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 554</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equites medios tramittunt campos,</quote> <trans><tr>ride through</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:330" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 330</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cursu campos (cervi),</quote> <trans><tr>run through</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 154</bibl></cit>: quantum Balearica torto Funda potest plumbo medii transmittere caeli, <hi rend="ital">can send with its hurled bullet</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">can send its bullet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:710" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 710</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tectum lapide vel missile,</quote> <trans><tr>to fling over</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 4, 6, § 33</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">flumina disco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:677" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 677</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">duo sinus fuerunt, quos tramitti oporteret: utrumque pedibus aequis tramisimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transmissus amnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumen ponte transmittitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 8, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48851.11" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab eo loco conscendi ut transmitterem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum exercitus vestri numquam a Brundisio nisi summā hieme transmiserint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:12:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 12, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum a Leucopetrā profectus (inde enim tramittebam) stadia circiter CCC. processissem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 7, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">8, 13, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 11, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex Corsicā subactā Cicereius in Sardiniam transmisit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 7, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 9, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab Lilybaeo Uticam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:31:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 31, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad vastandam Italiae oram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:51:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 51, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:38:11" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 38, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:36:7" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 36, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">centum onerariae naves in Africam transmiserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:24:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 24, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:58" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cyprum transmisit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:1:27" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 1, 27</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Ebusum insulam transmissum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:20:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 20, 7</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n48851.12" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to go over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">desert</hi> to a party: <cit><quote lang="la">Domitius transmisit ad Caesa rem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:84" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 84 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> (syn. transfugio).—</sense><sense id="n48851.13" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n48851.14" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to pass over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leave untouched</hi> or <hi rend="ital">disregarded</hi> (syn praetermitto): <cit><quote lang="la">haud fas, Bacche, tuos taci tum tramittere honores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:162" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 162</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiam silentio, deinde oblivio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil silentio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 13</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">4, 31: aliquid dissimulatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 13, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae ipse pateretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 15</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n48851.15" n="2" level="3"> In partic., of time, <hi rend="ital">to pass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spend</hi> (syn. ago): <cit><quote lang="la">tempus quiete,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: so, <cit><quote lang="la">vitam per obscurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 19:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 19, 2</bibl></cit>: <pb n="1893" /> <cb n="TRAN" /> steriles annos, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:2:12" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 2, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aevum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 4, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quattuor menses hiemis inedia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 25, 38, § 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigiles noctes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:278" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 278</bibl></cit> et saep. — <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">febrium ardorem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to undergo</tr>, <tr>endure</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:22:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 22, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">discrimen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 8:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secessus, voluptates, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 6:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 4, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
transmontanus: <entryFree id="n48852" type="main" key="transmonta_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trans-montānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <sense id="n48852.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. m.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that is beyond the mountains</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tramontane</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">subactis cis Apenninum omnibus tum transmontanos adortus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 2, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 28</bibl>; in <number>sing.</number>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 154</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
transmotio: <entryFree id="n48853" type="main" key="transmo_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transmōtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>transmoveo</etym>, <sense id="n48853.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a transposition</hi>, = metathesis, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, § 525</bibl>; Aquil. Röm. de Fig. Sent. § 16.</sense></entryFree>
transmoveo: <entryFree id="n48854" type="main" key="transmo^ve^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trans-mŏvĕo</orth>, no <sense id="n48854.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ōtum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to remove</hi> from one place to another. * </sense><sense id="n48854.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Syriā transmotae legiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48854.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to transfer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloriam Verbis in se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, § 525</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
transmutatio: <entryFree id="n48855" type="main" key="transmu_ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transmūtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>transmuto</etym>. <sense id="n48855.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a changing</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Jacob. 1, 17</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n48855.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a shifting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transposition</hi> of letters (post-Aug.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">transpositio, commutatio),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:39" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:89" default="NO">9, 4, 89</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
transmuto: <entryFree id="n48856" type="main" key="transmu_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trans-mūto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n48856.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to change</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shift</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transmute</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">commuto, verto, converto): transmutans dextera laevis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:488" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 488</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(fortuna) transmutat incertos honores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 51</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48856.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To transfer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remove</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aegros ad alium locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:15:142" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 15, 142</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
transnato: <entryFree id="n48857" type="main" key="transna^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trans-năto</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">trānăto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n48857.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to swim over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">across</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">through; absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perpauci viribus confisi transnatare contenderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 22, 34, § 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 66</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec e Tigri pisces in lacum transnatant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 27, 31, § 127</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">num tuum nomen vel Caucasum transcendere potuit, vel illum Gangem tranatare?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:20:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 20, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
transnavigo: <entryFree id="n48858" type="main" key="transna_vi^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trans-nāvĭgo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n48858.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sail across</hi> or <hi rend="ital">over</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">angustias maris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 1:4" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 1, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tot maria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Dial. 1, 1</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a Xerxe transnavigatus est Athos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:2:10" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 2, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
transno: <entryFree id="n48859" type="main" key="transno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. trano.</entryFree>
transnominatio: <entryFree id="n48860" type="main" key="transno_mi^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transnōmĭnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>transnomino</etym>, a pure Lat. appellation for <sense id="n48860.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">metonymy</hi>, Don. p. 1776 P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 452</bibl> ib.</sense></entryFree>
transnomino: <entryFree id="n48861" type="main" key="transno_mi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trans-nōmĭno</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n48861.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to name over again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">change the name of</hi> a person or thing <hi rend="ital">to</hi> something else (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">Septembrem mensem et Octobrem ex appellation ibus suis Germanicum Domitianumque transnominavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Gram. 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui prior et Christum suum in homines annuntiaret et Jesum transnominaret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 39 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
transnumero: <entryFree id="n48862" type="hapax" key="transnu^me^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trans-nŭmĕro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n48862.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to count over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">count out</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 50, 63</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
transpadanus: <entryFree id="n48863" type="main" key="Transpa^da_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Trans-pădānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n48863.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is beyond the Po</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Transpadane</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 17, 21, § 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Italia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 29, 41, § 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coloni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clientes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alarii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 17, 7</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Transpădāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the nations beyond the Po</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 13, 34, § 127</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 1, 2</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Transpadanus,</quote> <trans><tr>a man from beyond the Po</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:39:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 39, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
transpectus: <entryFree id="n48864" type="hapax" key="transpectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transpectus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>transpicio</etym>, <sense id="n48864.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a looking</hi> or <hi rend="ital">seeing through</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:272" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 272</bibl> (corresp. to the preced. and foll. transpiciuntur).</sense></entryFree>
transpertusus: <entryFree id="n48865" type="hapax" key="transpertu_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trans-pertūsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [pertundo], <sense id="n48865.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pierced through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perforated</hi>: terminus, Auct. Limit. p. 302 Goes.</sense></entryFree>
transpicio: <entryFree id="n48866" type="main" key="transpi^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transpĭcĭo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">trans-spĭcĭo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>specio</etym>, <sense id="n48866.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to look</hi> or <hi rend="ital">see through</hi> (ante- and post-class., and very rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:271" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 271</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:278" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 278</bibl>: per eas membranas sensus ille, qui dicitur mens, ea quae sunt foris transpicit, Lact. Opif. Dei, 8 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></sense></entryFree>
transplanto: <entryFree id="n48867" type="main" key="transplanto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trans-planto</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n48867.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to transplant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remove</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et erit quasi lignum quod transplantatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:17:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 17, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in desertum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:19:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ezech. 19, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Luc. 17, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">di transplantati,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>deified human beings</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> 2, 258</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
transpono: <entryFree id="n48868" type="main" key="transpo_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trans-pōno</orth>, <itype>pŏsŭi, pŏsĭtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n48868.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to place</hi> or <hi rend="ital">set over</hi> or <hi rend="ital">across; to remove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transfer.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48868.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">statuam in inferiorem locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:5:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">advecta onera in flumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:61:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 61, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militem dextras in terras iturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victorem exercitum in Italiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:3:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 23, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cb n="TRAN" /> locum Pisonis Annali, <hi rend="ital">to transfer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:9:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 9, 1</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n48868.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., of plants, <hi rend="ital">to set out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transplant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arborem in locum alium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:1:16" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">brassicam Novembri incohante,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Sept. 13, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
transportatio: <entryFree id="n48869" type="main" key="transporta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transportātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>transporto</etym>, <sense id="n48869.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a removing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transmigration</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">populorum transportationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Helv. 6:section=12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Helv. 6, § 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
transporto: <entryFree id="n48870" type="main" key="transporto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trans-porto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n48870.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to carry over</hi> or <hi rend="ital">across</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to carry</hi> or <hi rend="ital">convey</hi> from one place to another; <hi rend="ital">to remove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transport.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48870.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ad onera ac multitudinem jumentorum transportandam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duas legiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equitem phalangemque ratibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:8:6" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum in Macedoniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:20:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 20, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Harudes in Galliam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum in naves impositum in Hispaniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 17, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victorem exercitum (in Italiam),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:41:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 41, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pueros in Graeciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 17, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quas (copias) secum transportārat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Agrippam in insulam,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to transport</tr>, <tr>banish</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:65" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 65 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—With the body of water as the object: <cit><quote lang="la">ripas horrendas et rauca fluenta,</quote> <trans><tr>to carry across</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:328" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 328</bibl></cit>.—With a twofold object: <cit><quote lang="la">milites his navibus flumen transportat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum Rhenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 4, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48870.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Danubius duratus glacie ingentia tergo bella transportat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:12:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 12, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
transpositiva: <entryFree id="n48871" type="hapax" key="transpo^si^ti_va"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transpŏsĭtīva</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>transpono</etym>, <sense id="n48871.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">transposition</hi>: <foreign lang="greek">meta/lhyin,</foreign> quam nos varie translativam, transumptivam, transpositivam vocamus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:46" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 46</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
transpositus: <entryFree id="n48872" type="main" key="transpo^si^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transpŏsĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of transpono.</entryFree>
transpungo: <entryFree id="n48873" type="main" key="transpungo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trans-pungo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n48873.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to prick</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pierce through</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:4:66" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 4, 66</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
transrhenanus: <entryFree id="n48874" type="main" key="Transrhe_na_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Trans-rhēnānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n48874.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is beyond the Rhine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Transrhenish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Germani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Batavians</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 1, 2, § 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lares,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 20, 4, 4</bibl></cit>. — As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Transrhēnāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">those living beyond the Rhine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
transscendo: <entryFree id="n48875" type="main" key="transscendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transscendo</orth>, <itype>ĕre, and its derivatives</itype>, v. transcendo, etc.</entryFree>
transscido: <entryFree id="n48876" type="main" key="transsci_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transscīdo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. transcido.</entryFree>
transscribo: <entryFree id="n48877" type="main" key="transscri_bo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transscrībo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. transcribo.</entryFree>
transsero: <entryFree id="n48878" type="main" key="transse^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transsĕro</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, v. transero.</entryFree>
transsilio: <entryFree id="n48879" type="main" key="transsi^li^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transsĭlĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, v. transilio.</entryFree>
transspectus: <entryFree id="n48880" type="main" key="transspectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transspectus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, v. transpectus.</entryFree>
transspicio: <entryFree id="n48881" type="main" key="transspi^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transspĭcĭo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. transpicio.</entryFree>
transsulto: <entryFree id="n48882" type="main" key="transsulto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transsulto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. transulto.</entryFree>
transsumo: <entryFree id="n48883" type="main" key="transsu_mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transsūmo</orth>, <itype>ĕre, and its derivatives</itype>, v. transumo, etc.</entryFree>
transsuo: <entryFree id="n48884" type="main" key="transsu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transsŭo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. transuo.</entryFree>
transthebaitanus: <entryFree id="n48885" type="main" key="Transthe_ba^i_ta_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Transthēbăītānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>trans-Thebais</etym>, <sense id="n48885.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is beyond Thebais</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Treb. Pol.</author> Gall. 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
transtiberinus: <entryFree id="n48886" type="main" key="Transti^be^ri_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Trans-tĭbĕrīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n48886.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is beyond the Tiber</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Transtiberine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambulator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:42:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 42, 3</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Transtĭ-bĕrīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">those dwelling beyond the Tiber</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 23, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
transtigritanus: <entryFree id="n48887" type="main" key="Transti_^gri_ta_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Trans-tī^grītānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Tigris</etym>, <sense id="n48887.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is beyond the Tigris</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Transtigritane</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 18, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reges,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 21, 6, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">22, 7, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
transtillum: <entryFree id="n48888" type="hapax" key="transtillum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transtillum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>transtrum</etym>, <sense id="n48888.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little cross-beam</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
transtineo: <entryFree id="n48889" type="hapax" key="transti^ne^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trans-tĭnĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>teneo, II.</etym>, <sense id="n48889.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to go through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pass through</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">commeatus transtinet trans parietem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:5:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 5, 58</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
transtrum: <entryFree id="n48890" type="main" key="transtrum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transtrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>root tra-, to cross; cf. trans</etym> (cf. jugum). <sense id="n48890.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a crossbeam</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transom</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 1</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 10, 21; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:123 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 12, 32, § 123 al.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">transtra et tabulae navium dicuntur et tigna, quae ex pariete in parietem porriguntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=367" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 367</bibl></cit> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n48890.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">a cross-bank</hi> in a vessel, <hi rend="ital">a bank for rowers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a thwart.</hi>— </sense><sense id="n48890.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:51:section=135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 51, § 135</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Epit. 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:147" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 147</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:573" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 573</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 663</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:534" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 534</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:543" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 543</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
transulto: <entryFree id="n48891" type="hapax" key="transulto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transulto</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">transsulto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n48891.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. n.</hi> [transsilio], <hi rend="ital">to leap over</hi> or <hi rend="ital">across</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in recentem equum ex fesso armatis transultare mos erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:29:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 29, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
transumo: <entryFree id="n48892" type="main" key="transu_mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transūmo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">trans-sūmo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n48892.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to take</hi> from one to another; <hi rend="ital">to adopt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assume</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.): hastam laevā,<cb n="TRAN" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:292" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 292</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mutatos cultus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 242</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
transumptio: <entryFree id="n48893" type="hapax" key="transumpti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transumptĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>transumo</etym>, <sense id="n48893.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a taking</hi> or <hi rend="ital">assuming of one thing for another</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transumption</hi>, <hi rend="ital">metalepsis</hi>, a transl. of <foreign lang="greek">meta/lhyis,</foreign> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:37" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
transumptivus: <entryFree id="n48894" type="hapax" key="transumpti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transumptīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>transumptio</etym>, <sense id="n48894.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">transumptive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">metaleptic</hi>: <foreign lang="greek">meta/lhyin,</foreign> quam nos varie translativam, transumptivam, transpositivam vocamus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:46" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 46</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
transuo: <entryFree id="n48895" type="main" key="transu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transŭo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">trans-sŭo</orth>, <itype>sŭi, sūtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n48895.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sew</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stitch through; to pierce through</hi> (not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">exteriorem partem palpebrae acu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 7, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mediam partem subulā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:5:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exta verubus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:363" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 363</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad ipsas radices per medium acu duo lina ducente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 7, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
transutus: <entryFree id="n48896" type="main" key="transu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of transuo.</entryFree>
transvado: <entryFree id="n48897" type="main" key="transva^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trans-vădo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n48897.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cross over</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">torrens qui non potest transvadari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:47:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 47, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48897.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to pass by</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scopulis quaestionum transvadatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 14, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
transvarico: <entryFree id="n48898" type="hapax" key="transva^ri^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trans-vărĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n48898.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to stretch the feet apart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to straddle</hi> in walking, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 3, 60</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
transvectio: <entryFree id="n48899" type="main" key="transvecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transvectĭo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">trāvectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>transveho</etym>, <sense id="n48899.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a passing over</hi> or <hi rend="ital">across</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crossing; a carrying</hi> or <hi rend="ital">transporting past.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48899.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: travectio Acherontis, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:5:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 5, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:51:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 51, 1</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n48899.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., in publicists' lang., <hi rend="ital">a riding past</hi> of the Roman knights before the censor, <hi rend="ital">a review</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">reducto more transvectionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 38</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:46:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 46, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 4, 5, § 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Vir. Ill. 32" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Vir. Ill. 32</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
transvectus: <entryFree id="n48900" type="main" key="transvectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transvectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of transveho.</entryFree>
transveho: <entryFree id="n48901" type="main" key="transve^ho"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trans-vĕho</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">trāvĕho</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n48901.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to carry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conduct</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">convey across</hi> or <hi rend="ital">over; to transport</hi> (syn.: transporto, transmitto). </sense><sense id="n48901.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n48901.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid militum transvexisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum in Britanniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:58" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 58</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">copias ponte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 24, § 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut jam Hispanos omnes inflati transvexerint utres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:47:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 47, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dardanium agmen (pons),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:489" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 489</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agmina classe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:494" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 494</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus defuncti per vicos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:13:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 13, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 1964" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 1964</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">navem Argo umeris transvectam Alpes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 18, 22, § 128</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n48901.3" n="b" level="4"> Mid.: transvehor, <hi rend="ital">to go</hi>, <hi rend="ital">come</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">travel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ride</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">sail across</hi> or <hi rend="ital">over</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caerula cursu, Cic. poët. Fin. 5, 18, 49: Medi, Persae ... navibus in Africam transvecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 18, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones ex Siciliā in Africam transvectae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 28:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 28, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum duabus quinqueremibus Corcyram transvectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vada Tartari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 889" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 889</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transvectae (sc. equo) a fronte pugnantium alae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 37</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ludicro Circensium Britannicus et Nero transvecti sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 12, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transvehitur Tuscos,</quote> <trans><tr>flies past</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 2, 272</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48901.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n48901.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To carry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lead</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">conduct along</hi> in triumph: <cit><quote lang="la">signa tabulasque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:12" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma spoliaque multa Gallica carpentis transvecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 7, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48901.6" n="2" level="3"> Of the Roman knights, <hi rend="ital">to ride past</hi> before the censor for review (syn. traduco), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:46:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 46, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:4:2:section=4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 4, 2, § 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:2:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 2, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48901.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of time, <hi rend="ital">to pass by</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elapse</hi> (Tacitean): <cit><quote lang="la">abiit jam et transvectum est tempus, quo, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transvecta aestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
transvena: <entryFree id="n48902" type="main" key="transve^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transvĕna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>transvenio</etym>, <sense id="n48902.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who comes over</hi> from another place, <hi rend="ital">a newcomer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stranger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foreigner</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">traditur, Lydos ex Asiā transvenas in Etruriā consedisse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transvena Loth,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Carm. Sodom. 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
transvendo: <entryFree id="n48903" type="gloss" key="transvendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trans-vendo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n48903.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to dispose of by sale</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alienate</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4431</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
transvenio: <entryFree id="n48904" type="main" key="transve^ni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trans-vĕnĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n48904.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to come</hi> from another place or person (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">anima inde (a Deo) transvenit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
transverbero: <entryFree id="n48905" type="main" key="transverbe^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trans-verbĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n48905.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to strike</hi> or <hi rend="ital">beat through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to thrust through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pierce through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transfix</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeclara bestia venabulo transverberatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abiete pectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:667" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 667</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clipei aera (hasta),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 336</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in utrumque latus transverberatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aëra volitando,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 46, 37</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
transversarius: <entryFree id="n48906" type="main" key="transversa_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transversārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>transversus</etym>, <sense id="n48906.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lying across</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cross-. transverse</hi>: tigna,<pb n="1894" /> <cb n="TRAN" />  <hi rend="ital">cross-beams</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 15</bibl>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">transversārĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. ligna), <hi rend="ital">cross-beams</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:11" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 11</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
transverse: <entryFree id="n48907" type="main" key="transverse_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transversē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. transverto <sense id="n48907.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
transversim: <entryFree id="n48908" type="main" key="transversim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transversim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. transverto <sense id="n48908.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
transversus: <entryFree id="n48909" type="main" key="transversus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transversus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-vorsus</orth>) or <orth extent="full" lang="la">trāver-sus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of transverto.</entryFree>
transverto: <entryFree id="n48910" type="main" key="transverto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trans-verto</orth>, <itype>ti, sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n48910.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to turn</hi> or <hi rend="ital">direct across</hi> or <hi rend="ital">athwart</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n48910.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quae defensio fuerat, eadem in accusationem transverteretur,</quote> <trans><tr>should be turned</tr>, <tr>converted</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 325, 33</bibl></cit>: eorum consilia hac atque illac variā cogitatione, <hi rend="ital">to turn over</hi>, Firm. Math. 6, 15.—</sense><sense id="n48910.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to turn away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">avert</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inimica,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 219</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortes meos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Praescr. 37</bibl></cit>. — Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">transversus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-vorsus</orth>) or <orth extent="full" lang="la">trāver-sus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">turned across;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">going</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lying across</hi>, <hi rend="ital">athwart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crosswise; cross-</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transverse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">traverse</hi> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n48910.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">viae,</quote> <trans><tr>cross-streets</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:53:section=119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 53, § 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tramites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:39:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 39, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">limites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fossa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fossas viis praeducit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vallum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tigna,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transversosque volare per imbres fulmina cernis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 213</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nubila portabunt venti transversa per auras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Manilium nos vidimus transverso ambulantem foro,</quote> <trans><tr>across the forum</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:33:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 33, 133</bibl></cit>: taleae ne plus quattuor digitos transversos emineant, <hi rend="ital">four fingers across</hi>, <hi rend="ital">four finger-breadths</hi>, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 18, 29, § 126</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">prov.: si hercle tu ex isto loco Digitum transversum aut unguem latum excesseris,</quote> <trans><tr>a fingerbreadth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 1, 1, 18</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">digitus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 18, 58</bibl></cit> (v. digitus); <cit><quote lang="la">for which, also: discedere a rectā conscientiā traversum unguem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 20, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(versibus) incomptis allinet atrum Transverso calamo signum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:447" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 447</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut transversus mons sulcetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:4:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: plurimum refert, concava sint (specula), an elata; <cit><quote lang="la">transversa, an obliqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 9, 45, § 129</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n48910.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">transversum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <hi rend="ital">a cross direction</hi> or <hi rend="ital">position</hi>, only with <hi rend="ital">prepp. adv.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crosswise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transversely</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">non prorsus, verum ex transverso cedit, quasi cancer solet,</quote> <trans><tr>obliquely</tr>, <tr>sideways</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e transverso vacefit locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1018" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1018</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paeninsula ad formam gladii in transversum porrecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 26, § 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in transversum positae (arbores),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 42, 81, § 222</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aratione per transversum iteratā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 20, 49, § 180</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 9, 37, § 118</bibl> (al. saepe traversa): <cit><quote lang="la">collectus pluvialis aquae transversum secans,</quote> <trans><tr>intersecting diagonally</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Limit. p. 43" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Limit. p. 43</bibl></cit> Goes.; cf. <usg type="style">poet.</usg> in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">(venti) mutati transversa fremunt,</quote> <trans><tr>at right angles to their former direction</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 19</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:154" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 154</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:348" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 348</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48910.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">transversa incurrit misera fortuna rei publicae,</quote> <trans><tr>crossed</tr>, <tr>thwarted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:97:331" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 97, 331</bibl></cit>: cum coepit transversos agere felicitas, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to lead aside</hi> or <hi rend="ital">astray</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 8:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 8, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">transversum judicem ferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:110" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 110</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 17, 31, § 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:1" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 1, 1, § 1</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n48910.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">transversum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, only with <hi rend="ital">prepp. adv.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecce autem de transverso L. Caesar, ut veniam ad se, rogat,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>contrary to expectation</tr>, <tr>unexpectedly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecce tibi iste de transverso, Heus, inquit, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 10, 14</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: quod non exspectes, ex transverso fit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec calamitas ex transverso accidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 231" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 231</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">advv.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48910.7" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">transversē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-vorsē</orth>), <hi rend="ital">crosswise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transversely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obliquely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">transverse describantur horae in columellā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 9, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 26, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 2, 5, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48910.8" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">transversim</orth>, <hi rend="ital">transversely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crosswise</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">obliquatis manibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Bapt. 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
transvolito: <entryFree id="n48911" type="hapax" key="transvo^li^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trans-vŏlĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n48911.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fly through</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clausa domorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:355" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 355</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
transvolo: <entryFree id="n48912" type="main" key="transvo^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trans-vŏlo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">trā-vŏlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n48912.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fly over</hi> or <hi rend="ital">across.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48912.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">perdices non transvolant Boeotiae fines in Atticā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 29, 41, § 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pontum (grues),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 23, 30, § 60</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n48912.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to go</hi>, <hi rend="ital">come</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mount</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">pass quickly over</hi> or <hi rend="ital">across.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48912.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n48912.4" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: Alpes, Asin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:31:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 31, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Oceanum (manus Macedonum),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 22, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delphini vela navium transvolant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 8, 7, § 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transvolat vox auras,</quote> <trans><tr>flies through</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:559" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 559</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:602" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 602</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: importunus (Cupido) transvolat aridas Quercus (i. e. vetulas). <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:13:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 13, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48912.5" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">foraminibus liquidus quia transvolat ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:349" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 349</bibl></cit>: eques <cb n="TREB" /> transvolat inde in partem alteram, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:63:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 63, 2</bibl>: Nilus insulas dierum quinque cursu non breviore transvolat, <hi rend="ital">flows by</hi> or <hi rend="ital">past</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 9, 10, § 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultur relicto Tityo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 1233" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 1233</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(arma) Travolaverunt ad hostes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1</bibl></cit>. 1, 33 (for transfugerunt, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 28</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n48912.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa Sallustiana brevitas ... audientem
