trepondo: <entryFree id="n48968" type="main" key="tre^pondo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĕpondo</orth>, <sense id="n48968.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">neutr. indecl.</hi> [tres-pondus; cf. duapondo, under duo], <hi rend="ital">three pounds</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejusdem radicis trepondo, panacis pondo IV.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 165" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 165</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adipis porcinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:ib. 271" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 271</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tres: <entryFree id="n48969" type="main" key="tre_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trēs</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">treis</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">trīs</orth>; <case>acc.</case> tres and tris), <itype>trĭa</itype>, <pos>num. adj.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. tri-, trajas; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">trei=s, tri/a;</foreign> Goth. thrija; Germ. drei; Engl. three</etym>. <sense id="n48969.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Three</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">duas, tris minas auferunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tria corpora, Tris species tam dissimiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:93 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 93 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horum trium generum quodvis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:26:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 26, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc loquor de tribus his generibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 28, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribus modis, uno ... altero ... tertio ...,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:30:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 30, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundos decem et tres reliquit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 7, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48969.1" n="II" level="1"> To denote a small number: <cit><quote lang="la">(sermo) tribus verbis,</quote> <trans><tr>of three words</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 29</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">verbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4</bibl></cit>. 2, 121; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 3, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:3:26" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 3, 26</bibl>: ego tribus primis verbis, quid noster Paetus; <cit><quote lang="la">at ille, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>at the first three words</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 19, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec omnia in tribus verbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:78" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">chartis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suavia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:79:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 79, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tribus illa bibit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:124:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 124, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tresdecim: <entryFree id="n48970" type="main" key="tresde^cim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tresdĕcim</orth>, v. tredecim <sense id="n48970.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
tressis: <entryFree id="n48971" type="main" key="tressis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tressis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>tres-as</etym>, <sense id="n48971.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Three</hi> asses, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=169" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 169</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:9:section=81" default="NO">9, § 81</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n48971.1" n="II" level="1"> To denote <hi rend="ital">a trifle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic Dama est non tressis agaso,</quote> <trans><tr>is not worth three coppers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:76" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 76</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tresviri: <entryFree id="n48972" type="main" key="tresvi^ri"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tres-vĭri</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n48972.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">three men holding an office together</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">associated in public business</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a board of three</hi>, <hi rend="ital">three joint commissioners;</hi> as overseers of prisons, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 3, 2, 2</bibl>.—As inferior priests: <cit><quote lang="la">tresviri epulones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:19:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 19, 73</bibl></cit> (v. epulo).—As commissioners to distribute land among colonists, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:44:10" default="NO" valid="yes">39, 44, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:29:2" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 29, 2</bibl>; cf. also under Treveri.</sense></entryFree>
treveri: <entryFree id="n48973" type="main" key="Tre_ve^ri"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Trēvĕri</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Trēvĭri</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n48973.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A people in</hi> Gallia Belgica, <hi rend="ital">between the Moselle and the forest of Ardennes</hi>, in and about the mod. <hi rend="ital">Treves</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 11</bibl>; 6, 8 et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:2:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 17, 31, § 106</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 107 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Epit. 107 al.</bibl>—In <number>sing.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Trēvĭr</orth>, <hi rend="ital">one of the Treviri</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 35</bibl>; <cb n="TRIB" /> 4, 55; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:441" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 441</bibl>.—In a pun with tresviri, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 13, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48973.1" n="B" level="2"> Afterwards, <hi rend="ital">the town of the Treviri</hi>, the mod. <hi rend="ital">Treves</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 11, 9</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called, at an earlier date, Augusta Trevirorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:2:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48973.2" n="II" level="1"> Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Trēvĕ-rĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Treveri</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 20, 49, § 183</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:262" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 49, 109, § 262</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 42 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Treves</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Urb. 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
triacontas: <entryFree id="n48974" type="greek" key="tri^a_conta^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭācontăs</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">triakonta/s,</foreign> <sense id="n48974.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the number thirty</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 49 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
triangularis: <entryFree id="n48975" type="main" key="tri^angu^la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭangŭlāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>triangulus</etym>, <sense id="n48975.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a triangle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">triangular</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">anfractus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 579</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
triangulus: <entryFree id="n48976" type="main" key="tri^angu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭangŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tres-angulus</etym>, <sense id="n48976.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having three corners</hi> or <hi rend="ital">angles</hi>, <hi rend="ital">threecornered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">triangular.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48976.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sidera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:42:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 42, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forma cutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:25:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 25, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">species (Siciliae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:2:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latera radicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:13:11:218" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 13, 11, 218</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n48976.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48976.3" n="a" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭangŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a triangle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadrata amplius spatium complectuntur triangulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:41" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 41</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 10, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:49:125" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 49, 125</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 8, 39, § 61</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48976.4" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭangŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a triangle</hi>, Front. Expos. Form. pp. 32, 33, 35 Goes.</sense></entryFree>
triarii: <entryFree id="n48977" type="main" key="tri^a_ri^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭārĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>tres</etym>, <sense id="n48977.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a class of Roman soldiers who formed the third rank from the front</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the triarii</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=89" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 89</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">etiamsi te sors inter triarios posuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 3:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 3, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 5, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">a primā acie ad triarios sensim referrebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 8, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 10, 6</bibl>; cf. Becker, Antiq. 3, pt. 2, p. 249 sq.</sense></entryFree>
triarius: <entryFree id="n48978" type="main" key="Tri^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Trĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n48978.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname in the</hi> gens Valeria. </sense><sense id="n48978.1" n="I" level="1"> C. Valerius Triarius, <hi rend="ital">a friend of Cicero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:76:266" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 76, 266</bibl>; he is introduced as a speaker in Cicero's treatise de Finibus; v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:15:13 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 15, 13 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n48978.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">His father</hi> was named L. Valerius Triarius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:14:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 14, 37</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48978.3" n="III" level="1"> P. Valerius Triarius, <hi rend="ital">the accuser of M. Scaurus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:16:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 16, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 17, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trias: <entryFree id="n48979" type="greek" key="tri^a^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭăs</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tria/s,</foreign> <sense id="n48979.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the number three</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a triad</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 7, § 733</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
triatrus: <entryFree id="n48980" type="gloss" key="tri^a_trus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭātrus</orth>, <sense id="n48980.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a feast-day among the Tusculans</hi>, <hi rend="ital">three days after the Ides</hi>, Fest. s. v. quinquatrus, p. 257 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
tribacca: <entryFree id="n48981" type="main" key="tri^bacca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭbacca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. inauris) [tres-bacca], <sense id="n48981.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ear-drop consisting of three pearls</hi>, P. Syr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 55</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
triballi: <entryFree id="n48982" type="main" key="Triballi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Triballi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n48982.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Lower Mœsia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 26, 29, § 149</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 1, 1, § 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 10, 17, § 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tribas: <entryFree id="n48983" type="greek" key="tri^ba^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭbăs</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">triba/s</foreign> (rubbing), <sense id="n48983.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a woman who practises lewdness with women</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 14, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:91" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 91</bibl> tit.; 7, 67, 1; 7, 70, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:9" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tribocci: <entryFree id="n48984" type="main" key="Tribocci"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tribocci</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Triboci</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n48984.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a German people on the left shore of the Rhine</hi>, in mod. <hi rend="ital">Alsace</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 51</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 70</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tribon: <entryFree id="n48985" type="greek" key="tri^bo_n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭbōn</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tri/bwn,</foreign> <sense id="n48985.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a threadbare cloak</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 53</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tribonianus: <entryFree id="n48986" type="main" key="Tri^bo_ni^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Trĭbōnĭānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n48986.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated jurist in the time of the emperor Justinian</hi>, Just. Inst. prooem. § 3, 4.</sense></entryFree>
tribrachys: <entryFree id="n48987" type="greek" key="tri^bra^chys"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭbrăchys</orth>, <itype>yos</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tri/braxus,</foreign> <sense id="n48987.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a poetical foot consisting of three short syllables</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a tribrach</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:97" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 97</bibl>.—Called also in Lat. tribrevis, <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 475</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
tribrevis: <entryFree id="n48988" type="main" key="tri^bre^vis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭbrĕvis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <sense id="n48988.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the preced.</ref></xr> art.</sense></entryFree>
tribuarius: <entryFree id="n48989" type="main" key="tri^bu^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭbŭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tribus</etym>, <sense id="n48989.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a tribe</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tribes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimen sodalitiorum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a bribing of the tribes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:19:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 19, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 36</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tribula: <entryFree id="n48990" type="main" key="tri_bu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trībŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. tribulum.</entryFree>
tribulatio: <entryFree id="n48991" type="main" key="tri_bu^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trībŭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>tribulo</etym>, <sense id="n48991.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">distress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trouble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tribulation</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Jud. 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Psa. 125:2" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> in Psa. 125, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 108, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tribulatus: <entryFree id="n48992" type="main" key="tri_bu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trībŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tribulum</etym>, <sense id="n48992.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pointed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">toothed</hi> like a threshing-sledge: <cit><quote lang="la">falciculae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 43, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tribulis: <entryFree id="n48993" type="main" key="tri^bu_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭbūlis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>tribus</etym>, <sense id="n48993.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the same tribe</hi> with another. </sense><sense id="n48993.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">tribulis tuus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 23, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:19:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 19, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:16:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 16, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:15:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 15, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 16, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 13, 15</bibl> Orell. ad loc. —</sense><sense id="n48993.2" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">one of the lower classes of the people</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a common</hi> or <hi rend="ital">poor person</hi> (rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:50:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 50, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:58:8" default="NO">9, 58, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tribulo: <entryFree id="n48994" type="main" key="tri_bu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trībŭlo</orth>, no <sense id="n48994.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>tribulum</etym>. </sense><sense id="n48994.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to press</hi>: <foreign lang="greek">*qli/bw</foreign> tribulo, presso, premo. Gloss, Philox.; Cato. R. R. <cb n="TRIB" /> 23, 4.—</sense><sense id="n48994.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to oppress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">afflict</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">in omnibus tribulemur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Gnost. 13 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Serm. 22</bibl>, n. 1; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 1, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tribulosus: <entryFree id="n48995" type="main" key="tri_bu^lo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trībŭlōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tribulus</etym>. <sense id="n48995.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">full of thorns</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thistles</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">voragines viarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 3, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> — </sense><sense id="n48995.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">thorny</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rough</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 3</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribulosissima dissimulatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 7 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
tribulum: <entryFree id="n48996" type="main" key="tri_bu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trībŭlum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">trīvŏl-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>tero</etym>, <sense id="n48996.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a threshing-sledge</hi>, consisting of a wooden platform studded underneath with sharp pieces of flint or with iron teeth, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=21" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 21</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:22:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. R. 1, 22, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:1:52:1" default="NO">1, 52, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:298" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 30, 72, § 298</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 164</bibl>. — Collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">trībŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:20:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 20, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:23" default="NO">1, 6, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:52:7" default="NO">12, 52, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,015:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Par. 20, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tribulus: <entryFree id="n48997" type="main" key="tri^bu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭbŭlus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">trĭbŏl-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tri/bolos,</foreign> <sense id="n48997.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an instrument resting on three of its iron prongs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">while a fourth projected upward</hi>, thrown on the ground to impede an enemy's cavalry, <hi rend="ital">a caltrop.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48997.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribulos abjecerunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 3, 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48997.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, from its resemblance in form. </sense><sense id="n48997.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of thorn</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thistle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">land-caltrops</hi>: Tribulus terrestris, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 153</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:803" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 803</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 15, 54, § 91</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spinae et tribuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 3, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48997.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of water-plant</hi> bearing a prickly nut of a triangular form, <hi rend="ital">water - chestnut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">water - caltrops</hi>: Trapa natans, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 16, 58, § 98</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tribunal: <entryFree id="n48998" type="main" key="tri^bu_nal"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭbūnal</orth> (moleste diligentibus permittamus et tribunale dicere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 17</bibl>; yet <orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭbūnāle</orth> is found Corp. Inscr. Lat. 206, 24), <itype>ālis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>tribunus</etym>. <sense id="n48998.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n48998.1" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A raised semicircular</hi> or <hi rend="ital">square platform</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on which the seats of magistrates were placed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a judgment-seat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tribunal</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">suggestus, sella): compleatur tribunal,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:84:290" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 84, 290</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">popularis accessus ac tribunal,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:8:section=25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 8, § 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetor tribunal suum juxta Trebonii praetoris urbani sellam collocavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 20</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:98:17" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 98, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum de tribunali deturbavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 9, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(praetor) palam de sellā ac tribunali pronuntiat, Si quis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:38:section=94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 38, § 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem ad se vocari et de tribunali citari jussit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 7</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">16: pro tribunali agere aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 8, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 5, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui dicunt apud tribunalia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:134" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 134</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:156" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 156</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudatum ex quattuor tribu nalibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:5:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobis in tribunali praetoris urbani sedentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:37:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 37, 168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedens pro tribunali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:32:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 32, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Fulvius magnā circumfusus turbā ad tribunal consulis venit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 22, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 75</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48998.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The elevation in the camp</hi>, from which the general addressed the soldiers or administered justice, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:27:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 27, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 25</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">regium (sc. Porsenae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 12, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48998.3" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The seat of the prætor in the theatre</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 44</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48998.4" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A tribunal erected as a monument to a deceased person of high rank</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sepulcrum Antiochiae ubi crematus (Germanicus), tribunal Epidaphnae, quo in loco vitam finierat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 83</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4548</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48998.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">a mound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dam</hi>, <hi rend="ital">embankment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribunalia structa manibus ad experimenta altissimi aestūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 1, 1, § 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48998.6" n="B" level="2"> Of the persons who sit on a tribunal, <hi rend="ital">the magistrates</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne forum quem spectat et omne tribunal,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 57</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48998.7" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">height</hi>, <hi rend="ital">greatness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid superest ad honoris mei tribunal et columen, ad laudis meae cumulum?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 356, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tribunatus: <entryFree id="n48999" type="main" key="tri^bu_na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭbūnātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n48999.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the office and dignity of a tribune</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the tribuneship</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cotta, qui tribunatum plebis petebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:7:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 7, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:9:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 9, 20</bibl>; so of <hi rend="ital">the office of a tribune of the people</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:19:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 19, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:12:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 12, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:10:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 10, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:7:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 7, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:21:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 21, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:37:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 37, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:9:1 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 11, 9, 1 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:56:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 56, 2</bibl>.— Of <hi rend="ital">a military tribune</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribunatus commoda contemnere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 8, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7</bibl>. 30, 31, § 113.</sense></entryFree>
tribunicius: <entryFree id="n49000" type="main" key="tri^bu_ni_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭbūnīcĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n49000.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a tribune</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tribunitial</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribunicia potestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:28:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 28, 124</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:13:1" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 13, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:9:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 9, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 3:61:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 3, 61, 12</bibl> Dietsch; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">seditiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 37:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 37, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 18, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 1</bibl></cit>. mucro aliqui, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:9:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 9, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">comitia,</quote> <trans><tr>for the election of tribunes of the people</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 1</bibl></cit>. 1; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">candidati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 15</bibl></cit>. <pb n="1897" /> <cb n="TRIB" /> b, 4: <cit><quote lang="la">leges,</quote> <trans><tr>proposed by the tribunes of the people</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 8, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auxilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:1:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:2:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equites Romanos in tribunicium restituit honorem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of military tribunes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 77</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n49000.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭbūnīcĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one that has been a tribune</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an ex-tribune</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui aedilicii, qui tribunicii, qui quaestorii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:14:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 14, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:35:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 35, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">INTER TRIBVNICIOS RELATO,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>presented with the title of tribune</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3146</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tribunus: <entryFree id="n49001" type="main" key="tri^bu_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭbūnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>tribus, prop. the chief of a tribe; hence, in gen.</etym>, <sense id="n49001.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a chieftain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commander</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tribune.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49001.1" n="I" level="1"> Tribuni aerarii, <hi rend="ital">paymasters</hi>, who assisted the quaestors, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:10:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 10, 2</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=181" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 181</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=2" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 2</bibl> ib.; <cit><quote lang="la">called also tribuni aeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 2, 7, § 31</bibl></cit>. By the Lex Aurelia these tribuni aerarii were made judges on the part of the people: <cit><quote lang="la">(Milonem) tribuni aerarii condemnarunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 6, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 7, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">a tribunis aerariis absolutus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 16, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">in a pun with aerati (rich),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 16, 8</bibl></cit>. This judicial office was taken from them by Julius Cæsar, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:41" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 41</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49001.2" n="II" level="1"> Tribuni Celerum, <hi rend="ital">captains</hi> or <hi rend="ital">commanders of the</hi> Celeres, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:59:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 59, 7</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:2:2:section=15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 2, 2, § 15</bibl>; Weissenb. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:15:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 15, 8</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n49001.3" n="III" level="1"> Tribuni militares or militum, <hi rend="ital">tribunes of the soldiers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">military tribunes;</hi> these were officers of the army, six to each legion, who commanded in turn, each two months at a time: <cit><quote lang="la">qui M. Aemilio legati et praefecti et tribuni militares fuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:36:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 36, 99</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">militares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 3, 6, § 11</bibl></cit>; cf. in <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tribunus militaris depugnavi apud Thermopylas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:10:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 10, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a tribunis militum, praefectis reliquisque, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 39</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">militum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. in <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribunus militum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 4, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribuni cohortium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 20</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Stilonius Priscus qui tribunus cohortis, sub Classico fuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:9:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 9, 18</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tribunus minor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 7</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and tribunus legionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:2:20" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 2, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49001.4" n="IV" level="1"> Tribuni militum consulari potestate, <hi rend="ital">military tribunes with consular power;</hi> these were the highest officers of the State from A.U.C. 310 to A.U.C. 388. They were chosen from the patrician and plebeian orders, and were at first three, then six, and, after the year 352, eight in number, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 6, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 1, 2</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called tribuni consulares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 33</bibl></cit>; Becker, Antiq. 2, 2, p. 136 sq.—</sense><sense id="n49001.5" n="V" level="1"> Tribuni plebis, and more freq. simply tribuni, <hi rend="ital">tribunes of the people</hi>, whose office it was to defend the rights and interests of the Roman plebeians against the encroachments of the patricians, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:33:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 33, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:56:3" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 56, 3</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:33:58 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 33, 58 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:7:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 7, 16</bibl>; cf. Becker, Antiq. 2, 2, p. 247 sq.; Lange, Antiq. 1, 1, p. 592 sq., and the authorities cited by both.</sense></entryFree>
tribuo: <entryFree id="n49002" type="main" key="tri^bu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭbŭo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ūtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>tribus</etym>, <sense id="n49002.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to assign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">allot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bestow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give</hi>, etc. (syn.: do, dono, largior). </sense><sense id="n49002.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ei plurimum tribuamus, a quo plurimum deligimur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:15:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 15, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tribuendo suum cuique,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si uni omnia tribuenda sint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:17:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 17, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praemia alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:46" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus sceleribus tanta praemia tribuistis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 1, 18, 4</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">dona nulli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:402" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 402</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 5, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">beneficia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 11, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pretium aedium Aurelio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunias ex modo detrimenti,</quote> <trans><tr>to deal out</tr>, <tr>allot</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 64</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n49002.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n49002.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to grant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give</hi>, <hi rend="ital">show</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">render</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">misericordiam fortissimo viro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:34:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 34, 92</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">veniam alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inventoribus gratiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:5:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silentium orationi alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:12:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 12, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod tantum dignitatis civitati Aeduae tribuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi honorem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulieri honorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:11:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 11, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi turis honorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocabula monti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:621" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 621</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salutem mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 15</bibl></cit> (16), 2: <cit><quote lang="la">parem voluntatem paribus beneficiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacem terris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:1:44" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 1, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:358" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 358</bibl> et saep. —</sense><sense id="n49002.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n49002.5" n="1" level="3"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to grant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yield</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">concede</hi>, <hi rend="ital">allow</hi> something to a person or thing (syn. concedo): <cit><quote lang="la">si sit quispiam, qui aliquid tribuat voluptati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:30:106" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 30, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valetudini aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:49:119" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 49, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">observantiam officio, non timori neque spei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc matris precibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:689" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 689</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid rei publicae et amicitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 1</bibl></cit>: ego tantum <cb n="TRIB" /> tibi tribuo, quantum mihi fortasse arrogo, <hi rend="ital">I yield</hi> or <hi rend="ital">concede as much to you</hi>, <hi rend="ital">have as high an opinion of you</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum senatus impediretur quo minus, id quod hostibus semper erat tributum, responsum equitibus Romanis redderetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:14:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 14, 34</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">gratissimum mihi feceris, si huic commendationi meae tantum tribueris quantum cui tribuisti plurimum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 22, 2</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">nusquam tantum tribuitur aetati (quam Lacedaemone),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:18:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 18, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi tribuebat omnia,</quote> <trans><tr>gave me the preference in all things</tr>, <tr>deferred in every thing to me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:51:190" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 51, 190</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum universo ordini publicanorum semper libentissime tribuerim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos ne nominatim tradam, majoribus eorum tribuendum puto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribus in generibus rerum versari rhetoris officium ... demonstrativum est, quod tribuitur in alicujus certae personae laudem aut vituperationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:5:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 5, 7</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n49002.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To ascribe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attribute</hi> a thing to a person or thing as the cause: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid virtuti hostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid juri potius quam suae culpae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id tribuite vestrae culpae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 36, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid ignaviae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miseriae nostrae potius quam inconstantiae tribuere quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 3, 4 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n49002.7" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To set store by</hi>, with magnopere, multum, etc., <hi rend="ital">to make much of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus ille secundum fratrem plurimum tribuebat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne ob eam rem suae magnopere virtuti tribueret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49002.8" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To divide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distribute</hi> (syn. dispertio): <cit><quote lang="la">rem universam in partes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:41:152" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 41, 152</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:4:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 4, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">secundus (locus) in tempora tribuitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:55:107" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 55, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnem vim loquendi in duas partes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:6:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 6, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49002.9" n="5" level="3"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">to bestow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">spend upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devote to</hi> a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">comitiis omnibus perficiundis XI. dies tribuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his rebus tantum temporis tribuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliqua tempora litteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 4, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hann. 13, 2</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭbūtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a stated payment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a contribution</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tribute.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49002.10" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">in capita singula servorum et liberorum tributum imponebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a se intolerabilia tributa exigi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes Siculi ex censu quotannis tributa conferunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:53:section=131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 53, § 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tributa pendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceram in tributa praestare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 13, 45, § 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitates tributis liberare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tributo populo indicto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:60:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 60, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:31:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 31, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:48:8" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 48, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 47</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:54:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 54, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:3:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:3:3" default="NO">8, 3, 3</bibl>.—In the ante-class. collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭbūtus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>: cum tributus exigeretur, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 229, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tributus cum imperatus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:43 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 43 sq.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n49002.11" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n49002.12" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A contribution</hi> made for any private purpose (jurid. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:2:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 14, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:2:4" default="NO">14, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:4:5" default="NO">14, 4, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49002.13" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A gift</hi>, <hi rend="ital">present</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">Saturnalicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:17:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 17, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praestare tributa clientes cogimur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:188" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 188</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:4:86" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 4, 86</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tribus: <entryFree id="n49003" type="main" key="tri^bus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭbus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype> (<case>dat.</case> and <sense id="n49003.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribubus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:9:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 9, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 18, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:12:16" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 12, 16</bibl>, etc.; but trebibos, Ephem. Epigr. 2, 208, n. 299; never tribibus; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. G. 3, 376</bibl>, and v., in gen., Neue, Formenl. 1, 361 sqq.), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>tri-; root in tres (<case>dat.</case> tribus) and bhū; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">fu-</foreign> in <foreign lang="greek">fulh/;</foreign> v. Corss. Ausspr. 1, 163</etym>, orig. a third part of the Roman people; as their numbers increased it came to mean, </sense><sense id="n49003.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a division of the people</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a tribe</hi> (the number of these tribes finally increased to thirty-five, of which thirty-one were rusticae tribus or country tribes, and four urbanae tribus or city tribes; the following are the names of the tribes, the city tribes being printed in Italics, viz.: Aemilia, Aniensis, Arniensis, Claudia, <hi rend="ital">Collina</hi>, Cornelia, Crustumina, <hi rend="ital">Esquilina</hi>, Fabia, Falerina, Galesia, Horatia, Lemonia, Maecia, Menenia, Oufentina, <hi rend="ital">Palatina</hi>, Papiria, Pollia, Pomptina, Popilia, Pupinia, Quirina, Romilia, Sabatina, Scaptia, Sergia, Stellatina, <hi rend="ital">Suburana</hi>, Terentina, Tromentina, Veientina, Velina, Veturia, Voltinia. Some of these names are the same as the names of Roman gentes, and others are derived from the names of places where these tribes at first resided), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 4:9:17" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 4, 9, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:8:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 8, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:36:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 36, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:37:12" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 37, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:46:2" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 46, 2</bibl> Weissenb. ad loc.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Epit. 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:1:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 1, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:1:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:10:1" default="NO">9, 10, 1</bibl>; cf. Niebuhr, <cb n="TRIC" /> Röm. Gesch. 1, p. 426 sq.; <cit><quote lang="la">and see the names of these tribes in Inscr. Orell. II. pp. 11-28 and 147: inventum tamen esse fortem amicum ex eādem familia Q. Verrem Romilia,</quote> <trans><tr>of the Romilian tribe</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 8, 23</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Ser. Sulpicius, Q. F. Lemonia, Rufus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 9, 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">L. AVRELIVS L. FIL. CAMILIA FIRMVS, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3070</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Africanus censor tribu movebat eum centurionem, qui in Pauli pugna non affuerat,</quote> <trans><tr>removed</tr>, <tr>expelled from the tribe</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:67:272" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 67, 272</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">tribu movere aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:43:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 43, 122</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 15, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:24:7" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 24, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:18:6" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 18, 6</bibl>; 45, 15, 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:4:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 4, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbanae (tribus) in quas transferri ignominia esset, desidiae probro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 3, 3, § 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populus in tribus convocatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:19:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 19, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea multitudo tribus circuit, genibus se omnium advolvens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:37:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 37, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49003.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, comicè: <cit><quote lang="la">grammaticas ambire tribus,</quote> <trans><tr>to canvass the Grammarian tribe</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49003.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n49003.4" n="1" level="3"> Of Macedonians: <cit><quote lang="la">satellites illi ex tribu suā legunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:3:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 13, 3, 1</bibl></cit> (al. turbā).—</sense><sense id="n49003.5" n="2" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">the commonalty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the mass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mob</hi>, <hi rend="ital">poor people</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:15:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 15, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 4, 19, § 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equitem imitatae tribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:6:25" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 6, 25</bibl></cit>. — Prov.: sine tribu, <hi rend="ital">without rank</hi> or <hi rend="ital">position</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo sine tribu, sine nomine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:13:1" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 13, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tributarius: <entryFree id="n49004" type="main" key="tri^bu_ta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭbūtārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tributum</etym>, <sense id="n49004.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to tribute</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">necessitas,</quote> <trans><tr>of paying tribute</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:2:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 32, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum,</quote> <trans><tr>subject to tribute</tr>, <tr>tributary</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 1, 3, § 6</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">praedia tributaria sunt ea, quae in his provinciis sunt, quae propriae Caesaris esse creduntur (opp. stipendiaria),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:21" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:7:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thraces Macedonum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:4:1" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tributarius Gallus quidam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa,</quote> <trans><tr>concerning tribute</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:14:46" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 14, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabellae,</quote> <trans><tr>letters of credit</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:66:section=148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 66, § 148</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tributim: <entryFree id="n49005" type="main" key="tri^bu_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭbūtim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>tribus</etym>, <sense id="n49005.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">through each tribe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tribe by tribe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by tribes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tributim et centuriatim descriptis ordinibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 7, 15</bibl></cit>: legem centuriatis comitiis tulere, ut quod tributim plebes jussisset, populum teneret, i. e. <hi rend="ital">in the</hi> comitia tributa, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:55:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 55, 3</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:16:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 16, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nummis tributim divisis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 17, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectacula tributim data,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:34:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 34, 72</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 32, 67</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arripuit populum tributim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 69</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tributio: <entryFree id="n49006" type="main" key="tri^bu_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭbūtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>tribuo</etym>. <sense id="n49006.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A dividing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distributing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distribution</hi> (very rare): hanc <foreign lang="greek">i)sonomi/an</foreign> appellat Epicurus, id est aequabilem tributionem, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:19:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 19, 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tributio fit pro ratā ejus, quod cuique debetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:4:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 14, 4, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n49006.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A contributing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">paying of tribute</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:14:52" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 14, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:4:18" default="NO">50, 4, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tributor: <entryFree id="n49007" type="hapax" key="tri^bu_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭbūtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n49007.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a giver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imparter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tributor omnium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Trism. p. 92, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tributorius: <entryFree id="n49008" type="main" key="tri^bu_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭbūtōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n49008.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">concerning payment</hi> (jurid. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">tributoria actio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 14</bibl></cit>, tit. 4.</sense></entryFree>
tributum: <entryFree id="n49009" type="main" key="tri^bu_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭbūtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. tribuo <sense id="n49009.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
tributus: <entryFree id="n49010" type="main" key="tri^bu_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭbūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of tribuo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n49011" type="main" key="tri^bu_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭbūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tribus</etym>, <sense id="n49011.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">formed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">arranged into tribes</hi>: comitia, Laelius Felix ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:27:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 27, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:60:4 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 60, 4 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:56:2" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 56, 2</bibl> sq.; v. comitium.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n49012" type="main" key="tri^bu_tus3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭbūtus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. tributum, under tribuo <sense id="n49012.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
tricae: <entryFree id="n49013" type="main" key="tri_cae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trīcae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 11, 16, § 104</bibl>, orig. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Trīca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, like Apina, the name of a small town in Apulia; but cf. Sanscr. trkvan, thief; and Lat. tricor, extricare, etc.; hence, prov.</etym>, <sense id="n49013.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">trifles</hi>, <hi rend="ital">toys</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trumpery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stuff</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nonsense.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49013.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt apinae tricaeque et siquid vilius istis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:1:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Gri.</hi> Quid dare velis? Eloquere propere. <hi rend="ital">La.</hi> Nummos trecentos. <hi rend="ital">Gri.</hi> Tricas. <hi rend="ital">La.</hi> Quadringentos. <hi rend="ital">Gri.</hi> Tramas putridas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 5, 2, 36</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49013.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">hinderances</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vexations</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perplexities</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subterfuges</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quirks</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wiles</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tricks</hi>: judicia, lites, turbas, tricas, Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 8, 26</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quomodo illa (Tullia) fert publicam cladem, quomodo domesticas tricas!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 8, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil mihi opus est litibus neque tricis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:3:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 3, 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quas tu mihi tricas narras?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 5, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin tu istas mittis tricas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 1, 45</bibl></cit>; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 8, 29</bibl>; Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 5, 2</bibl>; cf.: trico, tricor, and tricosus.</sense></entryFree>
tricameratus: <entryFree id="n49014" type="main" key="tri^ca^me^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭcămĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tres-camera</etym>, <sense id="n49014.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having three chambers</hi> (late Lat.). ecclesia, Aug. Civ. Dei, 15, 26: inferiora ar <pb n="1898" /> <cb n="TRIC" /> cae bicamerata et tricamerata facies, Ambros. Hexaëm. 6, 9, n. 72.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">trĭcă-mĕrātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a room divided into three chambers</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Jovin. 1, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tricca: <entryFree id="n49015" type="main" key="Tricca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tricca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Triccē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*tri/kkh,</foreign> <sense id="n49015.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Thessaly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Peneus</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Trikala</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 8, 15, § 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 13, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 824" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 824</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Triccaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Tricca</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Arat. 206</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tricenarius: <entryFree id="n49016" type="main" key="tri_ce_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trīcēnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>triceni</etym>, <sense id="n49016.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">containing thirty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fistula,</quote> <trans><tr>thirty quarterdigits in diameter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 29" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:48" default="NO">48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">filius,</quote> <trans><tr>thirty years old</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Excerpt. Controv. 3:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Excerpt. Controv. 3, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Aug. 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 29" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:48" default="NO">48</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
triceni: <entryFree id="n49017" type="main" key="tri_ce_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trīcēni</orth>, <itype>ae, a</itype> (<sense id="n49017.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> tricenūm, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 49, 50, § 164</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:113" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 33, 39, § 113</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">num. distr. adj.</hi> [triginta], <hi rend="ital">thirty at a time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thirty each</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thirty.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49017.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, distributively: <cit><quote lang="la">lecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:26:section=58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 26, § 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tricenos milites ex singulis legionibus, Auct. B. Afr. 75, 5: dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:14:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 14, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amphorae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:3:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bini dentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 16, 15, § 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latent tricenis diebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 36, 60, § 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nummi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:27:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 27, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49017.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">thirty</hi> cardinally: <cit><quote lang="la">medica ab uno satu tricenis annis durat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 16, 43, § 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(inplent) anguillae in Gange amne tricenos pedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 3, 2, § 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:44:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 44, 1</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Gen.</hi> tricenūm, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 19, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 49, 50, § 164</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:113" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 33, 38, § 113</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 49" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 49</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tricennalis: <entryFree id="n49018" type="main" key="tri_cenna_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trīcennālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tricennium</etym>, <sense id="n49018.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to thirty years</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tricennial</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">incuria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ruf.</author> in Hier. 1, 11</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">trīcennālia</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a festival celebrated once in thirty years</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a tricennial festival</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Oros.</author> 7, 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
